Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory45.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Celica', 3: 'Here is a summary of recent reports, President Hassen.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Thank you.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: '...Just as I thought.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Celica', 3: "What's going on?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'The Corrupted are becoming more active. Is it because of the polymer materials that have fallen to Earth...? Or something else...', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Whatever it is, we have to deal with them.', 4: '1'}
{3: "As Hassen and Celica talk, Asimov enters from the side. Extracting the map from Hassen's file, he projects it on-screen."}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Just as the Science Council predicted. The Corrupted are becoming more active, with even the tendency to congregate into makeshift armies.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'It used to be that they followed instinct towards the same place. Now, they seem to be massing for coordinated attacks.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Celica', 3: "Did our operations to regain lost ground affect the Corrupted's movement patterns?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: "Maybe, maybe not. After all, Corrupted don't think like wild beasts.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: 'By your being here, Asimov, I take it that your department has already come up with a solution for this situation?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'In answer, Asimov pulls up blueprints for a Construct module on-screen.'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: "What's this?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'A Construct expansion module, named "Inver-Sync".', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'To fight an army of Corrupted, we need an army of our own, which we realistically cannot field.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "That's why we must unite the few Elite-level Constructs we have, and use them to elevate our entire force.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: 'So this module... can turn everyone into elite combatants?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: "Yes. Once Inver-Sync is activated, all Constructs in the area of operations can be linked, sharing each other's thoughts and connections.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'And achieve the "All Are One" combat doctrine.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: "...How's the module production going?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'We can ensure a certain usable amount, but the assembly line is unstable. Babylonia has many more pressing projects, after all.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Is that so... But as you said, my original intent was to meet the Corrupted, pound for pound.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: "After all, there's no way we're letting the Corrupted congregate unchecked. It would spell disaster if they were allowed to expand.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Celica.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Celica', 3: 'Yes, sir. What are your orders?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Recall all units available back to Babylonia. Asimov, you will coordinate efforts to install these modules on all Class 2 combatants.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Class 2... why not Class 1? Advanced Constructs would coordinate teams better.', 4: '2'}

{2: 'Hassen', 3: "We'll hold the advanced Constructs back, in case anything unexpected happens. It'd be trouble if the commanding Construct had to face powerful Corrupted alone. Better leave this to Class 1 Constructs.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "...It's just as well. I'm just the one who makes the tools. How you wield them is up to you.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: "It's settled then. Broadcast the orders, Celica. It is time for Joint Warfare.", 4: '1'}
